7/10 – GameSpot

About This Game

Taking its inspiration from ancient Chinese tales of revenge and retribution and then adding a dash of over-the-top martial arts and old school arcade fun, Kung Fu Strike features 28 stages of fast-paced combo-based fighting. Blend powerful punches, high kicks and perfectly timed blocks to pull off devastating combos, all thanks to a fluid combat system that turns brawling into an art form.

Key Features

  • Old-school beat-‘em-up arcade appeal!
  • Unlock items and abilities to further customize style of play.
  • Online leaderboards breed competition between players.
  • Later levels will challenge your Kung Fu on even the lowest difficulty setting.
  • Freely flowing combat mechanics allow jaw-dropping combos.
  • Fight with or against a friend in local co-op.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Win Vista (32/64 bit), Win XP
    • Processor: 2.0+ GHZ Single Core Processor
    • Memory: 1GB RAM GB RAM
    • Graphics: NVIDIA 6200+ or ATI Radeon 9600+, Shader Model 3.0 compatible
    • DirectX®: 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: 3 GB HD space
    • Sound: DirectX®: 9.0c compatible
    • Other Requirements: Broadband Internet connection
    • Additional: X360 controller support
    Recommended:
    • OS: Win Vista (32/64 bit), Win 7 (32/64 bit), Win XP
    • Processor: 3.0 GHZ Dual Core Processor
    • Memory: 1GB RAM GB RAM
    • Graphics: NVIDIA 7900 GS or Equivalent
    • DirectX®: 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: 3 GB HD space
    • Sound: DirectX®: 9.0c compatible
    • Other Requirements: Broadband Internet connection
    • Additional: X360 controller support

Gul'dan
241 products in account
7 reviews
Recommended
3.9 hrs on record
Posted: June 17
This game is a difficult beat 'em up were you fight a lot of enemies at the same time.

    Pros
  • A lot of replay value.
  • A bunch of upgrades to unlock.
  • Beautiful artwork.
  • Easy Controls (Keyboard and Controller).
  • Co-op makes the game more enjoyable.

    Cons
  • Once you get towards half of the game...the game gets pretty difficult. I ended up getting, for the most part, rank Ds on Easy/Normal difficulties.
  • Later levels seem almost impossible playing on singleplayer (THIS GAME IS MEANT TO BE PLAYED WITH SOMEONE ELSE).
  • Sometimes the enemies get overwhelming, so you HAVE to get rid of them quickly.

I luckily got this game for just $1, so in my opinion for that price is well worth it. I'd say for half the price or less this game is well worth it if you are into challenging games.

Epik!
304 products in account
19 reviews
Recommended
5.4 hrs on record
Posted: August 23
If you're looking for a cheap little beat em' up, then i got news for ya, you've came to the right place! This game is great, I mean just playing the game and beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of numerous enemies feels pretty damn good, and even though they for the most part overwhelm you they can easily be dispatched by numerous chi moves and combos. Unlocking moves, replaying missions just to get the coin for said moves also is cool and even though i really do not like grinding in some games, this game does it right somehow. It's also good to note that this game is 2 players and I haven't tried it out yet but from what i've heard it's more fun than playing in single player, which is to be expected. The game is also optimized incredibly well, which is good considering the extremely limited amount of video settings they give you. The only two problems I've had concerning this game however is getting it to launch, for some reason my game whenever i press the start button will not launch although the process is still going on in task manager so that's something to keep in mind whenever buying this game, the other problem is the camera angles in the game, i've had numerous occasions where i'd be fighting a boss and the camera cuts behind a rock, limiting my view. Anyways, i'd give this game a buy if you just want to see how you'd like it, stay cool folks!

MadbeinG
76 products in account
9 reviews
Recommended
17.9 hrs on record
Posted: October 27
Ok this is a very fluent game. The fighting is fun, chi attacks are awesome and when you do a chi attack while enemy is prepairing for one is GOD DAMN SATISFYING.

But(you can't evade the buts), there are some annoying things too. First of all the camera. You may not know how many times I died because of the camera shift while I'm whaling on someone or coupe of dudes running at me or when I'm about to deliver a sick chi attack! Other than camera shift while in combat there is this weird deal of the camera getting behind things and not being able to see the damn fight. And sometimes some short enemies stand right behind the character in the way I won't be able to see them and get killed by them.

If you can handle these issues than no problem, but again If you want to have more insight let me try to control my rant mode and try to point the other issues that are probably not a problem for everyone.

So there are some stages with a lot of enemies, A LOT, when in this kind of stiation and when you don't have anything to distract them like some allies or some diffirent type enemies or weird deal of attacking each other, the fluency flies of from your side and goes to the computer controlled dudes side. They whale on you! They do it like that is what they are programmed for (Probably that's why)! But damn they don't take a break, even the littlest of enemies do chi attacks and when you fall say bye bye to all of your trap cards ...(wait that's from somewhere else) you won't be able to get up probably. But If you have luck you might just be fine or If you are someone that's made out of reflexes.

When you are able to finish the game in the normal mode. You would probably want to do it again in hard mode right? Right indeed! But in this case game gets really hard. But that's want you wanted right? Game to be more challenging 'cause you handed It's ♥♥♥ when It was on normal. Well than, have a fun time swearing all over the place and to everything that exsits in the real world or anywhere else. Because damn I've been paying a lot without break and ... the anger I have is huge (♥♥♥♥ joke?). But that is probably my problem some anger issues for sure. When you are fighting and when there are really small time for you to react to every attacker, It gets on you. You won't be able to block 5 dudes continues attacks, you won't be able to block some weird ♥♥♥ attacks of some enemies. And projectiles? Don't get me started about the DAMN PROJECTILES! There some level with huge amount of projectile throwing on you and with some sword fighters. That is ,excuse my manners, F*CKING BULLSCHL*NG! Do you know why? Because If you are to try deflecting the non-stop projectile coming at you sword fighters will get you, If you are gonna fight with sword fighters well you know what will happen. And If one of the sword fighters is a type of boss, good luck saving your ♥♥♥ before It gets rendered like the cheese in a pizza or If you like on a dish of macaroni.

Other than angering deals, It does not have cut scenes other than comic book style story telling. And It kind of lacks the feeling of moving from places to places. I mean when I come to somewhere It's like I teleported there like the damn Doctor Who. And story is a bit not-there type. I mean yeah It is there, game tells you about It but It is more like a ghost that you hear all about but never be able to see with your own damn eyes.

In the end, this game is fun to play. Works almost flawlessly.And I hope I can play with my friends someday.
